intro: Decaspermum vitis-idaea, commonly known as whortleberry, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to northern regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a leathery texture. Decaspermum vitis-idaea thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in boreal and alpine environments.
